meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tedious.
meanings.sent1: The tediousnesses of the task made it hard to stay focused.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't handle the tediousnesses of the never-ending meeting.
meanings.sent3: The tediousnesses of waiting in line for hours was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The tediousnesses of the paperwork mountain felt like climbing a never-ending staircase.
meanings.sent5: The tediousnesses of the chore was like watching paint dry.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being bored or annoyed due to something being too long, slow, or repetitive.
meanings.sent1: Her yawns clearly showed her tediousnesses during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The tediousnesses of the movie made me want to leave the theater.
meanings.sent3: The tediousnesses of the waiting room music was oddly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The tediousnesses of the traffic jam was a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The tediousnesses of the lecture was like a lullaby putting me to sleep.
